data.title: Brazilian Real Pressured by USD Strength
data.description:
The Brazilian real weakened past 5.39 per US dollar, as a firm US dollar offset otherwise supportive domestic data.

The dollar firmed after the Fed’s 25bp cut was accompanied by Chair Powell’s warning that a further reduction in December is far from certain, keeping global funding conditions relatively tight.

Domestically, unemployment remained low at 5.6% in the September moving quarter, which supports consumption and tax receipts, adding to hawkish arguments for the Brazilian central bank.

However, those domestic positives have been offset by the limited nature of the US–China truce, which markets view as temporary, and by lingering fiscal and policy uncertainty, including failed congressional votes on revenue measures and earlier shifts to IOF rules that have kept some nonresident investors cautious.

data.title: TEREX CORP SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
Terex Corp, a global manufacturer of lifting and material processing products, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter of 2025. The report highlights significant financial growth and robust operational performance across its various business segments, despite facing some challenges related to tariffs and tax legislation changes.

Financial Highlights

Net Sales: $1,387 million, reflecting a 14% year-over-year growth driven by strong performance in the Environmental Solutions segment.

Gross Profit: $282 million, with a gross margin improvement due to cost reductions and favorable discrete items.

Operating Profit: $140 million, with a margin of 10.1%, flat year over year, supported by cost control and pricing actions.

Net Income: $65 million, impacted by higher effective tax rates due to changes in German tax legislation.

Diluted EPS: $0.98, reflecting the impact of lower net income and a slight decrease in the weighted average number of shares outstanding.

Business Highlights

Revenue Segments

  • Aerials Segment: Reported sales of $537 million in Q3 2025, with a focus on domestic production, as approximately 70% of products sold in the U.S. are manufactured domestically.
  • Materials Processing (MP) Segment: Had sales of $417 million, with a decline in Concrete and Cranes sales but growth in Global Aggregates.
  • Environmental Solutions (ES) Segment: Achieved $435 million in sales, driven by improved throughput and delivery of refuse collection vehicles and utility trucks.

Geographical Performance

  • North America: Remained the largest market for Terex, accounting for approximately 72% of global sales in Q3 2025. Sales in North America increased due to the ESG acquisition.
  • Western Europe: Sales were slightly up.
  • Asia Pacific and Other Regions: Experienced a decline in sales.

Sales Units

  • Aerials Segment: Maintained a strong competitive position with significant domestic production, including nearly all booms and scissors manufactured in the U.S.
  • Environmental Solutions (ES) Segment: Saw strong growth in refuse collection vehicles and utility trucks.

Future Outlook

  • Environmental Solutions (ES) Segment: Terex anticipates continued strong performance, with a focus on expanding its customer base and realizing economies of scale.
  • Materials Processing (MP) Segment: The company expects margin improvement as it closes out 2025.
  • Aerials Segment: Working on cost reduction and supply chain action plans to mitigate tariff-related inflation.

Operational Challenges

  • Faced challenges from higher tariff rates, particularly the expanded scope of Section 232 steel and aluminum tariffs, which impacted Aerials machines and components manufactured in Monterrey, Mexico. Despite these challenges, Terex continues to execute cost reduction strategies to mitigate the impact.

SEC Filing: TEREX CORP [ TEX ] - 10-Q - Oct. 31, 2025

data.title: SOUTHERN FIRST BANCSHARES INC SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
Southern First Bancshares Inc., a prominent financial institution known for its client-focused business model, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter of 2025. The report highlights significant financial growth and strategic business expansions, underscoring the company's robust performance and future outlook.

Financial Highlights

  • Total Interest Income: $54.99 million, driven by a $3.8 million increase in interest income on interest-earning assets.
  • Total Interest Expense: $27.46 million, reflecting a $3.1 million decrease in interest expense on interest-bearing liabilities.
  • Net Interest Income: $27.53 million, a 33.7% increase over the prior year, primarily due to higher interest income and lower interest expense.
  • Net Income: $8.66 million for the three months ended September 30, 2025, compared to $4.38 million for the same period in 2024, primarily driven by an increase in net interest income.
  • Diluted EPS: $1.07 for the third quarter of 2025, compared to $0.54 for the same period in 2024, reflecting improved profitability.
  • Net Interest Margin (TE): 2.62% for the third quarter of 2025, compared to 2.08% for the same period in 2024, indicating improved efficiency in earning assets.

Business Highlights

  • Client-Focused Business Model: The company continues to emphasize a client-focused business model, utilizing relationship teams to provide clients with a specific banker contact and support team responsible for all their banking needs. This structure aims to deliver a consistent and superior level of professional service, which is considered a critical part of the company's culture, referred to as 'ClientFIRST.'
  • Geographical Expansion: The company is expanding into the Charlotte, North Carolina, Greensboro, North Carolina, and Atlanta, Georgia markets. This expansion is part of the company's strategy to grow its presence in these regions, which are expected to contribute to future growth.
  • Loan Portfolio Composition: As of September 30, 2025, the company's loan portfolio is heavily concentrated in real estate loans, which represent 83.0% of total loans. This concentration reflects the company's strategic focus on real estate lending.
  • Operational Risk Management: The company is actively managing risks associated with interest rate changes, credit quality, and market conditions. This includes monitoring the impact of economic factors such as national GDP and unemployment rates on the loan portfolio.
  • Allowance for Credit Losses: The company has transitioned to a discounted cash flow approach for estimating the allowance for credit losses, allowing for better estimation of credit losses through customization among various inputs by loan segmentation.
  • Future Outlook: The company anticipates that lower interest rates, as initiated by the Federal Reserve in late 2024, may support loan demand but could also compress net interest margins. The company is also preparing for potential regulatory changes and economic conditions that could impact its operations.

SEC Filing: SOUTHERN FIRST BANCSHARES INC [ SFST ] - 10-Q - Oct. 31, 2025

data.title: OMEGA HEALTHCARE INVESTORS INC SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
Omega Healthcare Investors Inc., a leading real estate investment trust (REIT) focused on the healthcare sector, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter of 2025. The report highlights significant improvements in both financial and operational performance, driven by strategic investments and portfolio optimization efforts.

Financial Highlights

Omega Healthcare Investors Inc. reported robust financial results for the third quarter of 2025, showcasing substantial growth across key metrics:

  • Total Revenues: $311.6 million, reflecting an increase from $276.0 million in the prior year period, driven by higher rental and interest income.
  • Net Income: $184.956 million, up from $114.914 million in the prior year period, indicating improved profitability.
  • Net Income Available to Common Stockholders: $179.719 million, compared to $111.762 million in the prior year period, showing a significant increase.
  • Basic EPS: $0.60, compared to $0.43 in the prior year period, reflecting higher earnings per share.
  • Diluted EPS: $0.59, compared to $0.42 in the prior year period, indicating improved earnings performance.

Business Highlights

Omega Healthcare Investors Inc. also reported notable operational achievements and strategic initiatives during the third quarter of 2025:

  • Revenue Segments: The company reported rental income primarily from skilled nursing facilities (SNFs), assisted living facilities (ALFs), and other healthcare-related real estate properties. The rental income is divided into fixed income from operating leases and variable income, which includes reimbursements for real estate taxes.
  • Geographical Performance: Omega has a significant presence in the United Kingdom, Texas, and Indiana, with the U.K. representing the largest concentration of real estate assets. This geographical distribution highlights the company's strategic focus on these regions.
  • Sales Units: During the nine months ended September 30, 2025, Omega sold 45 facilities, including 42 SNFs and three ALFs, generating net cash proceeds of $264.1 million. This reflects the company's ongoing strategy to optimize its portfolio by divesting non-strategic assets.
  • New Product Launches: In February 2025, Omega completed and placed into service the Inspir Embassy Row project, an assisted living facility in Washington D.C., which is now generating rental income under a 24-year lease agreement.
  • New Production Launches: Omega invested in construction and capital improvement projects, including the development of skilled nursing facilities in Virginia, Florida, and Maryland. These projects are part of the company's efforts to expand and enhance its real estate portfolio.
  • Future Outlook: Omega is focused on transitioning facilities to new operators and finalizing agreements related to the transfer of licensure for certain assets. The company is also evaluating the impact of new accounting standards and regulatory changes on its operations.

SEC Filing: OMEGA HEALTHCARE INVESTORS INC [ OHI ] - 10-Q - Oct. 31, 2025

data.title: FARMERS & MERCHANTS BANCORP INC SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
Farmers & Merchants Bancorp Inc., a prominent commercial banking institution serving Ohio, Indiana, and Michigan, has released its latest Form 10-Q report, showcasing robust financial and operational performance. The report highlights significant growth in net income and earnings per share, alongside a steadfast focus on core banking operations and regional market service.

Financial Highlights

  • Net Income: $8.854 million, reflecting a significant increase from the previous period, indicating strong financial performance.
  • Net Income Per Share: $0.64, demonstrating an improvement in earnings per share compared to the prior year.

Business Highlights

  • Revenue Segments: The company operates primarily in the commercial banking segment, offering a wide range of financial products and services including commercial, agricultural, and residential mortgage lending, as well as consumer lending activities. The segment also provides commercial and consumer banking services, wealth advisory services, and insurance to individual and business clients across Ohio, Indiana, and Michigan.
  • Geographical Performance: The company continues to serve its clients through banking center locations in Ohio, Indiana, and Michigan, focusing on providing comprehensive financial services tailored to the needs of these regional markets.
  • Sales Units: The company reported servicing a significant volume of loans for others, with unpaid principal balances of 1-4 family real estate loans and agricultural real estate loans serviced for others amounting to $362.8 million and $152.3 million, respectively, as of September 30, 2025.
  • Future Outlook: The company remains focused on its core commercial banking operations, with an emphasis on maintaining strong credit quality and managing interest rate risk through strategic use of derivative financial instruments. The management is also reviewing recent accounting pronouncements to ensure compliance and optimize financial reporting.

SEC Filing: FARMERS & MERCHANTS BANCORP INC [ FMAO ] - 10-Q - Oct. 31, 2025

data.title: Eurozone Inflation Slows, Leaving ECB in Its Good Place
data.description:
By Paul Hannon

The annual rate of inflation in the eurozone slowed in October to just above the European Central Bank's target, giving policymakers little immediate reason to contemplate another change in their key interest rate.

The European Union's statistics agency Friday said consumer prices in the 20 countries that share the euro were 2.1% higher than a year earlier, a decline in the annual rate of inflation from the 2.2% recorded in September. The ECB targets an inflation rate of 2%.

The slowdown was largely due to a smaller increase in food prices over the year through October. Prices of manufactured goods cooled, while services prices rose at a slightly faster pace. The core rate of inflation, which excludes volatile food and energy prices, was unchanged at 2.4%.

The inflation rate has been no higher than 2.2% since March, while figures released Thursday showed the eurozone economy avoided a contraction in the six months that followed the imposition of sharply higher tariffs on its exports to the U.S.

In a news conference Thursday after policymakers left their key rate unchanged for the third straight meeting, ECB President Christine Lagarde said they were in "a good place," a signal that they see little reason to move the key rate up or down.

However, Lagarde said the outlook for inflation is more uncertain than usual, largely due to the impact of higher U.S. tariffs on global trade flows.

A stronger euro could lower inflation more than expected over coming months, as could an extended period of low growth as the tariffs hit demand for the eurozone's exports, she said. But inflation could also pick up if tariffs scramble global supply chains.

"We will take the necessary measures and steps on the basis of data, meeting by meeting, to make sure that we stay in a good place," Lagarde said.

Bank of France Governor Francois Villeroy de Galhau on Friday said the ECB should keep all its options open during upcoming meetings, an indication that policymakers may not have finished with rate cuts.

"In view of the various risks, including financial market risks, we must preserve full optionality to act as much as needed," said Villeroy, who is an ECB rate setter. "More than ever, agile pragmatism based on data and forecasts will be required at our upcoming meetings."

The ECB's economists expect the inflation rate to fall further in 2026 and average just 1.7%, before picking up to 1.9% in 2027. The central bank Friday said that economists at banks and other institutions it surveyed in early October expect inflation to be 1.8% next year, and 2% in 2027.

In a separate report summarizing its recent contacts with eurozone businesses, the ECB said they had reported a "further slight slowdown" in their selling prices.

"This was mainly driven by price moderation in the services sector, reflecting some cooling in price growth in labour-intensive sectors such as hospitality," the ECB said.

Policymakers have said they wouldn't change the key rate in response to what they perceive as short-lived deviations in the pace of price rises from their target, but would respond to larger shocks that threaten to move inflation away from 2% for a prolonged period.

Write to Paul Hannon at paul.hannon@wsj.com

data.title: CORNING INC /NY SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
Corning Inc., a global leader in glass science, ceramic science, and optical physics, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter of 2025. The report highlights significant financial and operational achievements, driven by robust demand across various segments and strategic management actions aimed at enhancing profitability and growth.

Financial Highlights

Net Sales: $4,100 million, an increase of 21% compared to the same period in 2024, primarily driven by an increase in sales for optical communication products.

Gross Margin: $1,520 million, up by 34% compared to the same period in 2024, driven by higher volume and management actions to improve profitability.

Income Before Income Taxes: $550 million, a significant turnaround from a loss of $92 million in the same period in 2024, primarily due to increases in gross margin and gains on translated earnings contracts.

Net Income Attributable to Corning Incorporated: $430 million, reflecting a substantial improvement from a net loss of $117 million in the same period in 2024.

Core Net Income: $585 million, an increase of 26% compared to the same period in 2024, driven by higher segment net income in Optical Communications and Specialty Materials.

Core Earnings Per Share: $0.67, up by 24% compared to the same period in 2024, primarily as a result of the changes in core net income.

Business Highlights

Revenue Segments:

  • Optical Communications: Significant increase in segment net sales, driven by strong demand for Generative AI products and datacenter interconnect products, with a 33% increase for the three months and 39% for the nine months ended September 30, 2025.
  • Specialty Materials: Experienced a 13% increase in segment net sales for the three months and an 11% increase for the nine months ended September 30, 2025, due to strong demand for premium glass for mobile devices.
  • Display: Decrease in net sales by 7% for the three months and 5% for the nine months ended September 30, 2025, primarily due to the impact of resetting the core rate from 107 to 120 Japanese yen to USD.
  • Automotive: Segment net sales increased by 6% for the three months ended September 30, 2025, driven by positive momentum in the global passenger vehicle market, particularly in China.
  • Hemlock and Emerging Growth Businesses: Saw a 46% increase in segment net sales for the three months and a 21% increase for the nine months ended September 30, 2025, primarily due to higher sales in solar businesses.

Geographical Performance: The company experienced strong demand in China, contributing to the positive performance in the Automotive segment.

Future Outlook: Corning expects core net sales of approximately $4.35 billion for the fourth quarter of 2025, indicating continued growth expectations.

Operational Strategy: The company is focused on driving profitable multiyear growth by inventing, making, and selling life-changing products, leveraging its expertise in glass science, ceramic science, and optical physics. Corning is committed to evolving with changing market needs and helping customers capture new opportunities in dynamic industries, positioning itself as a catalyst for positive change.

SEC Filing: CORNING INC /NY [ GLW ] - 10-Q - Oct. 31, 2025

data.title: Analysts Express Doubt Over China Fulfilling Soybean Buying Promises — Market Talk
data.description: Some analysts are unsure if the framework of the U.S.-China trade truce that includes soybean purchasing will take place as promised. One reason is because there's no penalties described to enforce China's purchasing of 12 million metric tons of soybeans in this marketing year, along with 25 million tons of soybeans annually for the following three years. "Whether China secures 25 MMTs in future years depends on the price relationships between South America and the U.S." AgResource says in a note. "China buys what China needs at the cheapest price offered--it's that simple." CBOT grains are lower in morning trade, with soybeans down 0.4%, corn off 0.5%, and wheat 0.1% lower. (kirk.maltais@wsj.com)

data.title: Canada Budget Deficit Swells in August Ahead of Annual Fiscal Plan
data.description:
By Paul Vieira

OTTAWA--Canada's budget deficit widened in August and in the first five months of the current fiscal year, offering a preview of public finances before the Liberal government delivers its annual budget plan next week.

Canada's budget deficit swelled in August to 3.28 billion Canadian dollars, or the equivalent of $2.34 billion, from a C$2.55 billion shortfall in the year-ago month, according to the Department of Finance's monthly fiscal monitor publication. For the April-to-August period, the deficit rose to C$11.07 billion, from a comparable C$9.84 billion from a year ago.

Finance Minister François-Philippe Champagne presents the government's budget plan on Tuesday, and officials have warned the deficit for the current fiscal year, which ends on March 31 of next year, would be significant. The Canadian parliament's budget watchdog has projected the deficit for the 2025-26 fiscal year will reach C$68.5 billion, or over 2% of gross domestic product. Some analysts, such as economists at the Toronto-based C.D. Howe Institute think tank and National Bank Financial, believe the budget deficit could reach much higher, in the C$90 billion range.

The higher deficit reflects a ramp up in defense expenditures, so Canada can meeting the spending requirements set out by the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, and planned spending to kick start infrastructure and resource projects.

The federal budget plan "will be a credit negative fiscal plan," say the team at National Bank Financial. Canada has a triple-A credit rating. "Even though ratings agencies haven't really been sounding the alarm in the lead-up to the budget, keep in mind that Canada's presence in the triple-A club is a more function of economic, institutional and monetary considerations. It's less a function of its balance sheet."

The August public-finance data indicate total tax revenue rose 9.5% in August to C$31.14 billion. Expenditures on government operations and programs jumped 9.1% to C$35.87 billion, while public-debt charges fell 1.5%, reflecting lower interest rates. As a result, total expenses climbed 8% in August.

Write to Paul Vieira at paul.vieira@wsj.com

data.title: LatAm assets set to end volatile month with modest gains
data.description:
Key points:
  • Brazil's stock benchmark on track for monthly gain
  • Argentine equities gain sharply, peso extends losses
  • Analysts warn of complex backdrop ahead

By Niket Nishant

Latin American stocks and currencies were set to eke out slim gains for the month on Friday as post-election optimism in Argentina and progress on U.S.-China trade talks tempered concerns over tariff tensions.

MSCI's index tracking regional stocks (.MILA00000PUS) was up 0.2%, while an equivalent currencies gauge (.MILA00000CUS) was flat. They were poised to end October with gains of 0.9% and 0.1%, respectively.

While long-term tailwinds, such as investor demand for diversification, have improved the region's prospects, October's price swings underscored Latin America's sensitivity to global economic shifts.

Investors could be confronted with a complex mix of challenges as they head into the final stretch of the year.

BRAZILIAN STOCKS GAIN, MEXICAN FX COOLS

In Brazil, the Bovespa index climbed 0.3% and was on track for its third straight monthly gain. Data released on Friday showed the country ended the third quarter with an unemployment rate of 5.6%, the lowest in history.

Investors also took heart from a slew of earnings reports, including from metal and mining company Vale , whose shares rose 1.6%.

Still, problems at Brazil's Braskem raised concerns about the health of the petrochemical industry. J.P. Morgan, meanwhile, raised its 2025 forecast for defaults on emerging-market high-yield corporate bonds.

Mexican equities were flat after hitting record highs on Wednesday, while the peso weakened against the dollar for the fourth straight day, falling 0.3%.

Argentine stocks gained 3.1%, gearing up for one of their best months on record. The peso was flat.

"Political risks have already eased with the midterm election, but that doesn't mean that economic risks are gone. The peso is still overvalued," said Mauricio Monge, senior economist at Oxford Economics.

"It's unclear what's going to happen with the peso. But the government will have the ammunition required to address this overvaluation without a strong pass-through to inflation."

The country is planning to marginally loosen the share of reserve requirements that commercial banks must report daily, aiming to revive lending and boost liquidity, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing a person familiar with the matter.

Chilean stocks were up 1.1% and the peso gained 0.1%.

Direct production costs at Chile's large copper mines fell in the first half of the year, the state-run Chilean Copper Commission said on Thursday, marking a reversal of the upward trend of recent years. The country is the largest producer of the red metal.

Separately, Morgan Stanley wrote in a note that emerging market governments have raised $5.1 billion through bond sales this week, pushing total issuance for the year to $239.8 billion, already surpassing any previous full-year record.

data.title: Homeowners Are Opting for Smaller Remodeling Projects, Floor & Decor CEO Says — Market Talk
data.description: Homeowners are scaling back remodeling projects, says Floor & Decor Chief Executive Thomas Taylor on the company's earnings call. "We continue to see a shift towards smaller projects such as tile focused bathroom projects, kitchens and restoration work," Taylor says. Those trends plus a stagnant home sales market led to a decline in same-store sales. Taylor says consumers aren't trading down and haven't pulled back due to higher prices. "They're buying the more expensive products and the better products. They're just doing less square footage and less projects," he says. (nicholas.miller@wsj.com)

Hong Kong's MTR Corp launches $25 billion debt issuance program
data.description:
Hong Kong's MTR Corp has launched a $25 billion debt issuance program, the company said in an exchange filing on Friday.

The rail operator has applied to the Hong Kong stock exchange for the listing of the notes under the program for a year, MTR said.

The listing is expected to become effective on November 3.

In March, MTR raised $3 billion in a three-tranche dollar bond deal, according to a term sheet reviewed by Reuters.

data.title: Wall Street set for monthly gains after Amazon's strong outlook
data.description:
Key points:
  • Indexes up: Dow 0.23%, S&P 500 0.63%, Nasdaq 1.2%
  • Amazon jumps as cloud growth beats expectations
  • Apple forecasts upbeat holiday-quarter iPhone sales
  • Warner Bros jumps after Reuters report of Netflix bid

By Pranav Kashyap and Nikhil Sharma

U.S. stock indexes rose on Friday, on track to end October with solid gains, as Amazon's upbeat earnings outlook helped ease jitters around AI overspending.

Amazon shares jumped 11% to an all-time high after the online retailer forecast quarterly sales above estimates, helped by cloud revenue rising at the fastest clip in nearly three years.

Apple's forecast for iPhone sales in the holiday quarter surpassed Wall Street expectations, but CEO Tim Cook flagged supply constraints. Its shares were last down 0.3%.

Nvidia , which became the first publicly listed firm to surpass $5 trillion in market value earlier this week, rose 1.6% after CEO Jensen Huang said he hoped the company's state-of-the-art Blackwell chips can be sold in China.

AI frenzy pushed Wall Street to record highs earlier this week before concerns about major spending from Microsoft and Meta as well as doubts about further interest rate cuts from the Federal Reserve spooked investors.

Still, for the month, the S&P 500 was up 2.6%, putting it on track for a sixth straight monthly gain - its longest such streak since August 2021.

The Nasdaq Composite was on pace for a seventh consecutive monthly advance, while the Dow was set for its sixth straight monthly win - their longest runs since January 2018.

At 10:50 a.m. ET, the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 111.01 points, or 0.23%, to 47,633.13, the S&P 500 gained 43.27 points, or 0.63%, to 6,865.61 and the Nasdaq Composite gained 282.67 points, or 1.20%, to 23,863.81.

While expectations for faster U.S. rate cuts buoyed stocks earlier in the month, markets are still adjusting to a shift in policy outlook after the central bank delivered a widely expected quarter-point rate cut but signaled that another move in December was not a "foregone conclusion".

Odds of a 25 bps cut in December have fallen since, with traders now pricing in a 62.8% chance of such a move versus 91% just a week ago.

"Recently we've kind of seen an everything rally, and that's because we are getting into this area where interest rates start to matter and interest rates are going lower," said Dennis Dick, chief strategist at Stock Trader Network.

"The market believes that the next Fed meeting is probably going to be a lot more dovish than Powell was."

Of the 278 S&P 500 companies that have reported third-quarter results so far, 83.1% have surpassed analysts' estimates, according to LSEG data. That's well above the historical average, where roughly 67% of firms beat forecasts.

In other moves, Warner Bros Discovery rose 3.5% following a Reuters report that Netflix was actively exploring a bid for the company's studio and streaming business.

Netflix added 3.7% as it unveiled plans for a 10-for-1 stock split.

Getty Images rose 14% after signing a global multi-year licensing agreement with Perplexity AI.

Western Digital jumped 7.3% to an all-time high after forecasting quarterly earnings above Wall Street estimates.

Solar panel maker First Solar surged 12.9% to a more than one-year high after surpassing expectations for third quarter sales.

Advancing issues outnumbered decliners by a 1.45-to-1 ratio on the NYSE, and by a 1.59-to-1 ratio on the Nasdaq.

The S&P 500 posted 15 new 52-week highs and 33 new lows while the Nasdaq Composite recorded 50 new highs and 113 new lows.
